$schema.description: A URL to the JSON Schema for this object.

email.description: The email address of the user. Only available for 'manager' and 'admin' account types.

metadata.description: Additional metadata associated with the user account. May include custom fields, preferences, or configuration data. Not available for viewer accounts.

name.description: The display name of the user.

organizations.description: List of organizations that the user has access to. Each organization represents a separate tenant or business entity within the system.

type.description: The type of account indicating the user's access level and permissions. Determines available operations and data access.

username.description: The username of the user. Only available for 'viewer' account types.

$schema.description: A URL to the JSON Schema for this object.

account.description: The user's account name or username used for authentication

$schema.description: A URL to the JSON Schema for this object.

name.description: The display name of the authenticated user

token.description: JWT authentication token issued upon successful login. Use this token in the Authorization header for subsequent API requests.

email.description: The email address of the user. Only available for 'manager' and 'admin' account types.

email.description: The user's email address. Required when authenticating as a 'manager' account type.

type.description: The type of account to authenticate. Determines the authentication method and access level.

username.description: The user's username. Required when authenticating as a 'viewer' account type.

BodyInverterDailyData.description: Daily aggregated metrics for individual inverters at 1-day intervals.

before.description: Number of historical intervals included in the response

data.description: Array of time-series data points matching the specified parameters

date.description: Target date for the data retrieval

interval.description: Time interval used for data aggregation

source.description: Data source type that was queried

unit.description: Data aggregation unit that was requested

unit.description: Data aggregation unit that was requested

value.description: The value at the given location

$schema.description: A URL to the JSON Schema for this object.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.
examples: Property foo is required but is missing.

errors.description: Optional list of individual error details

instance.description: A URI reference that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem.

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. This value should not change between occurrences of the error.

type.description: A URI reference to human-readable documentation for the error.

$schema.description: A URL to the JSON Schema for this object.

created.description: Timestamp when the plant record was created in the system. Uses ISO 8601 format with timezone information.

id.description: Unique identifier for the solar plant installation. Must be exactly 15 characters in length.

images.description: Array of image URLs associated with the plant. These may include installation photos, aerial views, or equipment images.

metadata.description: Additional metadata and configuration details for the plant. May include address, capacity, equipment counts, and custom properties.

name.description: Display name of the solar plant installation.

organization.description: Organization identifier that owns or manages this plant installation.

organizationData.description: Detailed information about the organization associated with this plant, including name, contact details, and branding.

updated.description: Timestamp when the plant record was last modified. Uses ISO 8601 format with timezone information.

$schema.description: A URL to the JSON Schema for this object.

created.description: Timestamp when the plant record was created in the system. Uses ISO 8601 format with timezone information.

id.description: Unique identifier for the solar plant installation. Must be exactly 15 characters in length.

images.description: Array of image URLs associated with the plant. These may include installation photos, aerial views, or equipment images.

metadata.description: Additional metadata and configuration details for the plant. May include address, capacity, equipment counts, and custom properties.

name.description: Display name of the solar plant installation.

organization.description: Detailed information about the organization that owns or manages this plant, including name, contact details, and branding.

updated.description: Timestamp when the plant record was last modified. Uses ISO 8601 format with timezone information.

date.description: Date of the data point in YYYY-MM-DD format

cumulative_energy.description: Cumulative energy production up to this point (kWh)

date.description: Date of the data point in YYYY-MM-DD format

energy.description: Total energy production for the time interval (kWh)

$schema.description: A URL to the JSON Schema for this object.

items.description: Array of plant installations for the current page

perPage.description: Number of items included per page

totalItems.description: Total number of plant installations available across all pages

totalPages.description: Total number of pages available based on the current page size

asset_id.description: Unique identifier for the physical asset to be registered (e.g., device serial number, inverter ID)

asset_type.description: Classification of the physical asset being registered

map_id.description: Logical identifier that maps the asset to its position within the plant's system layout

map_type.description: Type of logical mapping used to organize the asset within the plant hierarchy

registered.description: Timestamp when the asset should be considered registered. Must be in RFC3339 format.

registered_meta.description: Additional metadata associated with the registration event (JSON string or custom format)

tag.description: Optional descriptive tag or label for the asset (e.g., location, purpose, or custom identifier)

asset_id.description: Unique identifier for the physical asset (device, inverter, etc.)

map_id.description: Logical mapping identifier within the plant's system layout

map_type.description: Type of logical mapping used for the asset

registered.description: Timestamp when the asset was registered in RFC3339 format

tag.description: Additional metadata and tags associated with the asset registration

unregistered.description: Timestamp when the asset was unregistered in RFC3339 format (empty if still registered)

asset_id.description: Unique identifier for the physical asset to be unregistered (must match the originally registered asset ID)

asset_type.description: Classification of the physical asset being unregistered (must match the originally registered asset type)

map_id.description: Logical identifier that maps the asset within the plant's system layout (must match the originally registered map ID)

map_type.description: Type of logical mapping used for the asset (must match the originally registered map type)

tag.description: Optional descriptive tag or label for the asset (should match the originally registered tag if applicable)

unregistered.description: Timestamp when the asset should be considered unregistered. Must be in RFC3339 format and should be after the original registration date.

unregistered_meta.description: Additional metadata associated with the unregistration event (JSON string or custom format)

get.description: Retrieves comprehensive account information for the authenticated user. Includes account type, email/username, name, metadata, and associated organizations.

parameters.description: Authorization header containing the Bearer token used for user authentication and access control. Format: 'Bearer <token>'
parameters.name: Authorization

schema.description: Authorization header containing the Bearer token used for user authentication and access control. Format: 'Bearer <token>'

parameters.description: Specifies the type of user account making the request. Determines the access level and available operations. 'viewer' provides read-only access, 'manager' allows administrative operations, and 'admin' grants full system access.
parameters.name: Account-Type

schema.description: Specifies the type of user account making the request. Determines the access level and available operations. 'viewer' provides read-only access, 'manager' allows administrative operations, and 'admin' grants full system access.
Response body containing complete account information

post.description: Authenticates users using either email (for managers) or username (for viewers) with password. The response includes an authentication token for subsequent API calls. This endpoint does not require the Authorization header.

schema.description: Request body containing authentication credentials and account type
Response body containing complete account information and authentication token

post.description: Refreshes the authentication token for the user. Requires a valid existing token in the Authorization header. Returns a new JWT token for subsequent API calls.

get.description: Retrieves a paginated list of all solar plants associated with the user's account. Includes plant ID, name, location, organization information, and other relevant details with pagination support.

parameters.description: Authorization header containing the Bearer token used for user authentication and access control. Format: 'Bearer <token>'
parameters.name: Authorization

schema.description: Authorization header containing the Bearer token used for user authentication and access control. Format: 'Bearer <token>'

parameters.description: Specifies the type of user account making the request. Determines the access level and available operations. 'viewer' provides read-only access, 'manager' allows administrative operations, and 'admin' grants full system access.
parameters.name: Account-Type

schema.description: Specifies the type of user account making the request. Determines the access level and available operations. 'viewer' provides read-only access, 'manager' allows administrative operations, and 'admin' grants full system access.

parameters.description: Page number for pagination (1-based indexing). Determines which subset of results to return. Results from (page-1)*size to page*size will be returned.
parameters.name: page

schema.description: Page number for pagination (1-based indexing). Determines which subset of results to return. Results from (page-1)*size to page*size will be returned.

parameters.description: Number of items per page for pagination. Controls how many plant installations are returned in a single request. Maximum recommended value is 100.
parameters.name: size

schema.description: Number of items per page for pagination. Controls how many plant installations are returned in a single request. Maximum recommended value is 100.

parameters.description: Succeeds if the server's resource matches one of the passed values.
parameters.name: If-Match

schema.description: Succeeds if the server's resource matches one of the passed values.

parameters.description: Succeeds if the server's resource matches none of the passed values. On writes, the special value * may be used to match any existing value.

get.description: Retrieves paginated log entries for a specific inverter within a plant. Includes status messages, error codes, timestamps, and raw log data with Korean message translations.

get.description: Retrieves comprehensive time-series metrics data for a specific plant with configurable data source, aggregation unit, and time interval. Supports various combinations of panel, inverter, string, and plant-level data aggregation across different time intervals.

parameters.description: Authorization header containing the Bearer token used for user authentication and access control. Format: 'Bearer <token>'
parameters.name: Authorization

schema.description: Authorization header containing the Bearer token used for user authentication and access control. Format: 'Bearer <token>'

parameters.description: Specifies the type of user account making the request. Determines the access level and available operations. 'viewer' provides read-only access, 'manager' allows administrative operations, and 'admin' grants full system access.
parameters.name: Account-Type

schema.description: Specifies the type of user account making the request. Determines the access level and available operations. 'viewer' provides read-only access, 'manager' allows administrative operations, and 'admin' grants full system access.

parameters.description: Plant ID. A unique alphanumeric identifier representing the solar plant installation to fetch metrics data for. Must be exactly 15 characters in length.
parameters.name: plant_id

schema.description: Plant ID. A unique alphanumeric identifier representing the solar plant installation to fetch metrics data for. Must be exactly 15 characters in length.

parameters.description: Data source type. Indicates the origin of the data collection system. 'device' refers to panel-level monitoring devices, while 'inverter' refers to inverter-level data collection.
parameters.name: source

schema.description: Data source type. Indicates the origin of the data collection system. 'device' refers to panel-level monitoring devices, while 'inverter' refers to inverter-level data collection.

parameters.description: Data aggregation unit. Specifies the hierarchical level of data aggregation within the solar installation. 'panel' provides individual panel data, 'inverter' aggregates by inverter, 'string' aggregates by string configuration, and 'plant' provides plant-wide aggregated data.
parameters.name: unit

schema.description: Data aggregation unit. Specifies the hierarchical level of data aggregation within the solar installation. 'panel' provides individual panel data, 'inverter' aggregates by inverter, 'string' aggregates by string configuration, and 'plant' provides plant-wide aggregated data.

parameters.description: Time interval for data aggregation. Determines the temporal granularity of the returned time-series data. Supported intervals: '5m' (5 minutes), '15m' (15 minutes), '1h' (1 hour), '1d' (1 day), '1M' (1 month), '1y' (1 year).
parameters.name: interval

schema.description: Time interval for data aggregation. Determines the temporal granularity of the returned time-series data. Supported intervals: '5m' (5 minutes), '15m' (15 minutes), '1h' (1 hour), '1d' (1 day), '1M' (1 month), '1y' (1 year).

parameters.description: Target date for data retrieval. The specific date for which you want to retrieve solar plant metrics data. Must follow the ISO 8601 date format 'YYYY-MM-DD'.
parameters.name: date

schema.description: Target date for data retrieval. The specific date for which you want to retrieve solar plant metrics data. Must follow the ISO 8601 date format 'YYYY-MM-DD'.

parameters.description: Historical data range. Number of time intervals before the specified date to include in the response. This parameter allows retrieval of historical trend data. Note: Only applicable for daily and longer intervals (1d, 1M, 1y), not for intraday intervals (5m, 15m, 1h).
parameters.name: before

schema.description: Historical data range. Number of time intervals before the specified date to include in the response. This parameter allows retrieval of historical trend data. Note: Only applicable for daily and longer intervals (1d, 1M, 1y), not for intraday intervals (5m, 15m, 1h).

parameters.description: Data fields selection. Specifies which metrics or parameters to include in the response. Use 'all' to retrieve all available measurement fields, or specify individual field names (e.g., 'i_out' for output current, 'p' for power, 'energy' for energy production).
parameters.name: fields

schema.description: Data fields selection. Specifies which metrics or parameters to include in the response. Use 'all' to retrieve all available measurement fields, or specify individual field names (e.g., 'i_out' for output current, 'p' for power, 'energy' for energy production).

before.description: Number of historical intervals included in the response

data.description: Array of time-series data points matching the specified parameters

date.description: Target date for the data retrieval

interval.description: Time interval used for data aggregation

source.description: Data source type that was queried

unit.description: Data aggregation unit that was requested
